snippet: Despite the pleasant memories of eliminating the top-seeded Heat in the 1999 playoffs, the Knicks can’t count on a top-seeded team faltering against them, as the Bulls did on Sunday.
abstract: Harvey Araton On Baseball column holds that New York Knicks are playing well and cannot be counted out of the race for the Atlantic Division title.
lead_paragraph: Despite the pleasant memories of eliminating the top-seeded Heat in the 1999 playoffs, the Knicks can’t count on a top-seeded team faltering against them, as the Bulls did on Sunday.

headline.seo: Knicks Should Focus on Gaining Division, Not Eighth Place
headline.main: Eighth Place Is Good for Nostalgia but Little Else
headline.print_headline: Eighth Place Is Good for Nostalgia but Little Else
